verses.verse: The proverbs<WH4912> of Solomon,<WH8010> the son<WH1121> of David,<WH1732> king<WH4428> of Israel:<WH3478>
to know<WH3045> wisdom<WH2451> and instruction;<WH4148> to discern<WH995> the words<WH561> of understanding;<WH998>
to receive<WH3947> instruction<WH4148> in wise<WH7919> dealing,<WH6664> in righteousness, justice,<WH6664> and equity;<WH4339>
to give<WH5414> prudence<WH6195> to the simple,<WH6612> knowledge<WH1847> and discretion<WH4209> to the young man:<WH5288>
that the wise<WH2450> man may hear,<WH8085> and increase<WH3254> in learning;<WH3948> that the man of understanding<WH995> may attain<WH7069> to sound counsel:<WH8458>
to understand<WH995> a proverb,<WH4912> and parables,<WH4426> the words<WH1697> and riddles<WH2420> of the wise.<WH2450>
The fear<WH3374> of Yahweh<WH3068> is the beginning<WH7225> of knowledge;<WH1847> but the foolish<WH191> despise<WH936> wisdom<WH2451> and instruction.<WH4148>
My son,<WH1121> listen<WH8085> to your father<WH1>'s instruction,<WH4148> and don't<WH5203> forsake your mother<WH517>'s teaching:<WH8451>
for they will be a garland<WH3880> to grace<WH2580> your head,<WH7218> and chains<WH6060> around your neck.<WH1621>
My son,<WH1121> if sinners<WH2400> entice<WH6601> you,<WH14> don't consent.
If they say,<WH559> "Come<WH3212> with us,<WH693> Let's lay in wait for blood;<WH1818> let<WH6845>'s lurk secretly for the innocent<WH5355> without cause;<WH2600>
let<WH1104>'s swallow them up alive<WH2416> like Sheol,<WH7585> and whole,<WH8549> like those who go down<WH3381> into the pit.<WH953>
We<WH4672>'ll find all valuable<WH3368> wealth.<WH1952> We<WH4390>'ll fill our houses<WH1004> with spoil.<WH7998>
You shall cast<WH5307> your lot<WH1486> among<WH8432> us.<WH259> We'll all have one purse.<WH3599>"
My son,<WH1121> don't<WH3212> walk in the way<WH1870> with them.<WH4513> Keep your foot<WH7272> from their path,<WH5410>
for their feet<WH7272> run<WH7323> to evil.<WH7451> They hurry<WH4116> to shed<WH8210> blood.<WH1818>
For in vain<WH2600> is the net<WH7568> spread<WH2219> in the sight<WH5869> of any bird:<WH1167>
but these lay wait<WH693> for their own blood.<WH1818> They lurk secretly<WH6845> for their own lives.<WH5315>
So are the ways<WH734> of everyone who is greedy<WH1214> for gain.<WH1215> It takes away<WH3947> the life<WH5315> of its owners.<WH1167>
Wisdom<WH2454> calls<WH7442> aloud in the street.<WH2351> She utters<WH5414> her voice<WH6963> in the public squares.<WH7339>
She calls<WH7121> at the head<WH7218> of noisy places.<WH7218> At the entrance<WH6607> of the city<WH5892> gates,<WH8179> she utters<WH559> her words:<WH561>

"How long,<WH6612> you simple ones, will you love<WH157> simplicity?<WH6612> How long will mockers<WH3887> delight<WH2530> themselves in mockery,<WH3944> and fools<WH3684> hate<WH8130> knowledge?<WH1847>
Turn<WH7725> at my reproof.<WH8433> Behold,<WH5042> I will pour out my spirit<WH7307> on you.<WH3045> I will make known my words to you.<WH1697>
Because I have called,<WH7121> and you have refused;<WH3985> I have stretched out<WH5186> my hand,<WH3027> and no one has paid attention;<WH7181>
but you have ignored<WH6544> all my counsel,<WH6098> and wanted<WH14> none of my reproof;<WH8433>
I also will laugh<WH7832> at your disaster.<WH343> I will mock<WH3932> when calamity<WH6343> overtakes you;<WH935>
when calamity<WH6343> overtakes<WH935> you like a storm,<WH5492> when your disaster<WH343> comes<WH857> on like a whirlwind;<WH5492> when distress<WH6869> and anguish<WH6695> come on you.<WH935>
Then will they call<WH7121> on me,<WH6030> but I will not answer. They will seek me diligently,<WH7836> but they will not find me;<WH4672>
because they hated<WH8130> knowledge,<WH1847> and didn't<WH977> choose the fear<WH3374> of Yahweh.<WH3068>
They wanted<WH14> none of my counsel.<WH6098> They despised<WH5006> all my reproof.<WH8433>
Therefore they will eat<WH398> of the fruit<WH6529> of their own way,<WH1870> and be filled<WH7646> with their own schemes.<WH4156>
For the backsliding<WH4878> of the simple<WH6612> will kill<WH2026> them.<WH7962> The careless ease of fools<WH3684> will destroy them.<WH6>
But whoever listens<WH8085> to me will dwell<WH7931> securely,<WH983> and will be at ease,<WH7599> without fear<WH6343> of harm.<WH7451>"
